intro: Dodonaea paulinia, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. Dodonaea paulinia is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
